Home Projects Publications Awards
2021-2025, University of Chicago

  • HyperLoRA: Unsupervised Adaptation via Low-Rank Hypernetwork Weight Generation

    Developed hypernetwork-based framework for generating LoRA matrices from unlabeled target-domain data, enabling rapid online adaptation of deep learning models. Applied here to self-calibrating BCIs.

  • Barcoding and long-term tracking of cells using nitrogen-vacancy center as quantum sensor

    Identified and tracked living cells by resolving spatial orientations of NV centers as unique barcodes.

  • DropConnect: linear bottleneck architecture for RRAM fault-tolerant deep learning

    Explored a potential method to improve the robustness of deep learning models against the hardware faults on RRAM accelerator.

  • Phase-specific optogenetic stimulation and prefrontal-hippocampal coherence

    Optimized phase detection algorithms for phase-specific neurostimulation, and used the technology to understand prefrontal-hippocampal coherence.

2018-2020, Guangzhou, China

  • Neural correlates of implicit and explicit sensorimotor learning

    Investigated and theorized the interaction between implicit sensorimotor adaptation and explicit motor task learning.
